column4: Heya, I'm in the Kubuntu amd64 installer trying to figure out manual "Prepare Partitions" (with Konqueror running, impressive!).  Where's the online help for this complicated step?
partitioning isn't really complicated.  Are you at the partition manager now?
partition setup is partition setup.  Are you at the stage where you are to prepare partitions?
yup, I'm trying to figure out how to break up my spare partition into root-home-swap.
BTW thanks for helping out!  I'm happy to read web docs, but can't find something relevant.
By spare partition, do you mean free space on the same drive as windows?  Or is the extra partition left over from another linux install, or what?
from windows I set up a spare 27GB D: partition that I can blow away.
what do you mean /query me....?  Firefishe, yes it is NTFS.  I see how to change it to something else like ext3 but AIUI the recommendation is to have root-home-swap.
If you want to use the 27GB NTFS Partition, select the partition by double-clicking it--or maybe a single-click will do, don't do too many clicks, too fast.
either that, or highlight it, then select delete
Let the partition manager do it's thing, and when it's done, reselect it (it should show empty now.
